description: This taxonomy was designed to describe the type of events

predicates.description: The presence of any of the types of malware was detected in a system.
Malware attached to a message or email message containing link to malicious URL.

predicates.expanded: Hosting of malware on web page
predicates.description: Web page disseminating one or various types of malware.

predicates.expanded: Hosting of malware on web page
predicates.description: Web page disseminating one or various types of malware.

predicates.expanded: Replication and spreading of a worm
predicates.description: System infected by a worm trying to infect other systems.

predicates.expanded: Connection to (a) suspicious port(s) linked to specific malware
predicates.description: System attempting to gain access to a port normally linked to a specific type of malware.

predicates.expanded: Connection to (a) suspicious system(s) linked to specific malware
predicates.description: System attempting to gain access to an IP address or URL normally linked to a specific type of malware, e.g. C&C or a distribution page for components linked to a specific botnet.
Mass mailing of requests (network packets, emails, etc...) from one single source to a specific service, aimed at affecting its normal functioning.

predicates.expanded: Exploit or tool aimed at exhausting resources (network, processing capacity, sessions, etc...)
predicates.description: One single source using specially designed software to affect the normal functioning of a specific service, by exploiting a vulnerability.
Mass mailing of requests (network packets, emails, etc...) from various sources to a specific service, aimed at affecting its normal functioning.

predicates.expanded: Exploit or tool distribution aimed at exhausting resources
predicates.description: Various sources using specially designed software to affect the normal functioning of a specific service, by exploiting a vulnerability.
Logical and physical activities which – although they are not aimed at causing damage to information or at preventing its transmission among systems – have this effect.

predicates.expanded: Intentional disruption of data transmission and processing mechanisms
predicates.description: Logical and physical activities aimed at causing damage to information or at preventing its transmission among systems.
Single system scan searching for open ports or services using these ports for responding.
Scanning a network aimed at identifying systems which are active in the same network.
Transfer of a specific DNS zone.
Logical or physical interception of communications.
Mass emailing aimed at collecting data for phishing purposes with regard to the victims.
Hosting web sites for phishing purposes.

predicates.expanded: Aggregation of information gathered through phishing schemes
predicates.description: Collecting data obtained through phishing attacks on web pages, email accounts, etc...
Unsuccessful use of a tool exploiting a specific vulnerability of the system.
Unsuccessful attempt to manipulate or read the information of a database by using the SQL injection technique.
Unsuccessful attempts to perform attacks by using cross-site scripting techniques.
Unsuccessful attempt to include files in the system under attack by using file inclusion techniques.
Unsuccessful login attempt by using sequential credentials for gaining access to the system.
Attempt to acquire access credentials by breaking the protective cryptographic keys.
Unsuccessful login attempt by using system access credentials previously loaded into a dictionary.

predicates.expanded: Use of a local or remote exploit
predicates.description: Successful use of a tool exploiting a specific vulnerability of the system.
Manipulation or reading of information contained in a database by using the SQL injection technique.
Attacks performed with the use of cross-site scripting techniques.
Inclusion of files into a system under attack with the use of file inclusion techniques.
Unauthorised access to a system or component by bypassing an access control system in place.
Unauthorised access to a system or component by using stolen access credentials.
Unauthorised access to a system or component.
Unauthorised access to a set of information.
Unauthorised access to and sharing of a specific set of information.
Unauthorised changes to a specific set of information.
Unauthorised deleting of a specific set of information.

predicates.expanded: Misuse or unauthorised use of resources
predicates.description: Use of institutional resources for purposes other than those intended.

predicates.expanded: Illegitimate use of the name of an institution or third party
predicates.description: Using the name of an institution without permission to do so.
Sending an unusually large quantity of email messages.
Sending an email message that was unsolicited or unwanted by the recipient.

predicates.expanded: Distribution or sharing of copyright protected content
predicates.description: Distribution or sharing of content protected by copyright and related rights.

predicates.expanded: Dissemination of content forbidden by law (publicly prosecuted offences)
predicates.description: Distribution or sharing of illegal content such as child pornography, racism, xenophobia, etc...
Other unlisted events.
Field aimed at the classification of unprocessed events, which have remained undetermined from the beginning.
